sen.j: 明救（みょうぐ、天慶9年（946年） － 寛仁4年7月5日 (旧暦)（1020年7月27日））は、平安時代中期の天台宗の僧。
sen.e: Myogu (born 946, died July 5, 1020 (old lunar calender) July 27, 1020) was a priest of the Tendai Sect in the middle of the Heian Era.
Myogu (born 946, died July 5, 1020 (old lunar calender) July 27, 1020) was a priest of the Tendai Sect in the middle of the Heian Era.
Myogu (946 - August 2, 1020) was a priest of the Tendai Sect in the middle of the Heian period.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦にしました。

sen.j: 父は醍醐天皇の皇子有明親王。
sen.e: His father was the Imperial prince Ariakira, the son of the Emperor Daigo.

sen.j: 兄弟に大蔵卿源泰清らがある。
sen.e: His sibling includes the okuranokami MINAMOTO no Yasukiyo.

sen.j: 幼い頃に比叡山に上り、天台座主延昌 (僧)僧正に師事して顕教・密教を学んだ。
sen.e: In his childhood, he went to Hiei-zan Mountain to study kengyo and esoteric Buddhism under the archbishop Ensho (a priest), who was a tendai-zasu.
In his childhood, he went to Hiei-zan Mountain to study kengyo and esoteric Buddhism under the archbishop Ensho (a priest), who was a tendai-zasu.

In his childhood, he went to Mt. Hiei to study exoteric Buddhism and Esoteric Buddhism under the Sojo (high-ranking Buddhist priest) Ensho (a priest), who was a Tendai-zasu (head priest of the Tendai sect).
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: その後浄土院 (京都市左京区)（現在の京都慈照寺（銀閣寺）の近くにあった寺）に住したことから浄土寺の座主と称された。
sen.e: He later resided in Jodo-in Temple (Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City) (a temple which located near the present Jisho-ji Temple (Ginkaku-ji Temple) in Kyoto), giving him a nickname of the chief priest of Jodo-ji Temple.

He later resided in Jodo-in Temple (Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City) (a temple which was located near the present Jisho-ji Temple (Ginkaku-ji Temple) in Kyoto), giving him a nickname of chief priest of Jodo-ji Temple.

He later resided in Jodo-in Temple (Sakyo-ku Ward, Kyoto City) (a temple which was located near the present Jisho-ji Temple (Ginkaku-ji Temple) in Kyoto), giving him a nickname of chief priest of Jodo-ji Temple.

sen.j: 長徳４年（998年）頃から各方面より要請を受けて頻繁に修善・祈祷を行う。
sen.e: He started reparing and praying in response to various requests since around 998.
He started repairing and praying, in response to various requests, from around 998.

sen.j: 特にその長徳4年（998年）藤原道長の病に修善を行ったのを初め、長保4年（1002年）道長室源倫子の仁和寺大般若経供養奉仕、寛弘5年（1008年）の中宮藤原彰子御産をめぐる祈祷、長和2年（1013年）の道長の法性寺五壇修法奉仕など、道長一族に関するものが多かった。
sen.e: He was particularly involved in matters related to the clan of Michinaga such as disease restoration for FUJIWARA no Michinaga in 998, Daihannya-kyo kuyo service at Nina-ji Temple for Michinaga's wife, MINAMOTO no Rinshi in 1002, prayers for the child birth of the Empress FUJIWARA no Shoshi in 1008, and Godan-shuho service at Hossho-ji Temple for Michinaga in 1013.

sen.j: また宮中関係の祈祷にもしばしば招聘された。
sen.e: He was also often invited to prayers related to the Imperial Court.

sen.j: 長和2年（1013年）三条天皇の眼病平癒を内裏の裏仁殿において祈願し、権僧正に任じられ、寛仁3年（1019年）には僧正になり、同年天台座主にもなった。
sen.e: He appointed to the gon-no-sojo (a highest ranking priest below a sojo) when he prayed for the recovery of the Emperor Sanjo' eye disease at Urajin Hall of the Imperial Palace in 1013, and appointed to the sojo (the second highest rankling priest below a dai sojo) as well as tendai-zasu in 1019.

He was appointed to the Gonsojo (the lowest grade that can be held by one who has reached the highest rank in the hierarchy of Buddhist priests) when he prayed for the recovery of the Emperor Sanjo' eye disease at Urajin Hall of the Imperial Palace in 1013, and was appointed to the sojo (second highest rankling priest below a dai sojo) as well as Tendai-zasu (head priest of the Tendai sect) in 1019.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 彼が生涯に行った修法は五壇法を初め安鎮法・不動法・七仏薬師法など多岐にわたり、また良源から眼病平癒の秘法を伝授されたとも伝えられる験者だった。
sen.e: He practiced various esoteric Buddist methods throughout his life including Godan-ho Method, Anchin-ho Method, Fudo-ho Method and Shichibutsu-yakushi-ho Method, and he was a sage who is said to have been transmitted the secret art to cure eye diseases from Ryogen.

He practiced various esoteric Buddhist methods throughout his life including the Godan-ho (method placed by the five wise men), Anchin-ho (method of an esoteric rite for achieving peace and security of the state or of a new home), Fudo-ho (method of prayer for the aid of Fudo-myoo to end calamity and cause prosperity) and Shichibutsu yakushi ho (the method of the Yakushi and other six related wise men related used for a long life, health and a safe delivery), and he was a sage who is said to have been transmitted the secret art to cure eye diseases from Ryogen.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 弟子には如源・尋空らがいたが、寛仁4年7月5日に75歳で入寂した。
sen.e: He taught pupils such as Jogen and Jinku, and died on July 5, 1020 at age 75.
